title: AcessoSANData Plan
text:

In this presentation, I will introduce key concepts in data science and propose ideas for the AcessoSAN project.







Here are the main topics:


Introduction
The Open Science Framework
Git & GitHub
Quarto & Pipelines
Project Management
Conclusion




(Artwork by Allison Horst)

title: AcessoSANData Plan
text:
The Open Science Framework
OSF is a free and open source project management tool, created by the Center for Open Science, that supports researchers throughout their entire project lifecycle.





(Reproduced from the Center for Open Science)

title: AcessoSANData Plan
text:
Git & GitHub
Git is a version control system created by Linus Torvalds in 2005 while building the Linux kernel. It allows multiple people to work on a project simultaneously without interfering with each otherâ€™s changes.

title: AcessoSANData Plan
text:
Open-Source Program. Lang.


High-level programming languages.
R was started by professors Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman as a programming language to teach introductory statistics at the University of Auckland. It was release in 1993.
Python was created by Guido van Rossum and released in 1991.
statistical computing and data visualization versus general-purpose.
Science-driven versus industry-driven.

title: AcessoSANData Plan
text:
Data Science Workflow


Data science is the study of the generalizable extraction of knowledge from data (Dhar, 2023).

For some, data science is just statistics (Broman, 2013) (hype statistics). For others, itâ€™s a new interdisciplinary field that synthesizes statistics, informatics, computing, communication, management, and sociology (Cao, 2017).






(Reproduced from Wickham et al. (2023))

title: AcessoSANData Plan
text:
GitHub Flow
An adaptation of Git Flow, created by Vincent Driessen in 2010.





(Reproduced from Azure)

title: AcessoSANData Plan
text:
Closing Remarks
 
This presentation was created with the Quarto Publishing System. The code and materials are available on GitHub.





(Artwork by Allison Horst)
